attributes.action: Free travel for all children under 16 on all forms of London transport.
attributes.additional_details:
I strongly believe with this pandemic many parents have been greatly impoverished financially.
Not all children take bus or trams to school. Some require to take the tube or overground trains. So for the parents of those children to be penalised and have to pay for travel I believe is totally unfair.
Children and parents have suffered enough with school closures, parents income being cut or being furloughed. The govt should be supporting families not causing more financially hardship.
attributes.background: I want the government in particular the London Mayor to review the terms and conditions of the 11-15 year old Zip oyster scheme.

rejection.details:
The issue you raise is not the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament. Transport is the responsibility of the London Assembly and the Mayor's Office.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
